level.text: The provisions of this section shall govern the tabulation of absentee ballots submitted to the Board electronically or by mail, or those delivered to an early voting center or polling place on Election Day.
The handling and tabulation of absentee ballots shall:
Be conducted separately from the tabulation of all other ballots;
Otherwise be conducted in the same manner as non-absentee regular ballots, insofar as those procedures do not conflict with the provisions of this section.

Absentee ballots received by the Board prior to the close of business on the Friday preceding an election shall be tabulated after polls have closed on Election Day. Absentee ballots received after the Friday preceding an election shall be secured and tabulated ten (10) days after an election.
Prior to tabulation, the Executive Director’s designee shall verify that the voter signed the absentee ballot envelope.

In preparation for tabulation, the Executive Director’s designee shall open the outer mailing envelopes, and remove the inner secrecy envelope which contains the absentee ballot. Inner secrecy envelopes shall be sorted by ward and precinct.
Working precinct by precinct, the Executive Director’s designee shall:

Open the inner secrecy envelopes, being careful not to damage the ballot inside. If an absentee ballot is damaged in this process, the valid votes shall be reproduced on duplicate ballots, in accordance with the rules of this chapter; and

Inspect the absentee ballots for machine tabulation acceptability. All absentee ballots that are identified as not being machine readable shall be removed and reproduced on duplicate ballots in accordance with the rules of this chapter.
The absentee ballot shall be tabulated and counted as being cast in the ward and precinct in which the voter resides.
